captions.text: It kind of looks like a smoothie right now.
It is. It's like generic berry.
It's like if you were to dip fruit into chocolate with no nutritional value.
Like if I'm going to do this, I'm going to eat the fruit and not gain 10 pounds.
This is cookie dough flavored cream
A really terrible, fake cookie dough taste.
That doesn't taste anything like cookie dough.
There are a lot of flavors happening in my mouth right now.
No, it's the fake strawberry that's really awful.
The only thing that watermelon should be mixed with is vodka.
It tastes like watermelon and jolly rancher
Wait! It does taste like watermelon.
That tastes just like Minute Maid limeade.
Ooo! The end of this is so sugary and limey.
This is like the food equivalent of a limearita.
It smells like you threw up after eating fruit punch.
It kind of smells like Kool-Aid.
It tastes like a pixie stick.
It's like somebody dipped a packet of pre-made drink into the Oreo cream.
The sugar overload is like *exploding sound*.
I mean it is really accurate. It's crazy.
I feel like I just walked into Starbucks.
It tastes like pumpkin pie. It's great.
It's kind of like ginger snappy.
It's a good mix of flavors.
Having the cookie there is like the crust to the pumpkin pie.
I would have this after Thanksgiving for sure.
Can I cookie monster these Oreos?

title: The Great American Oreo Taste Test

comments.text:
+Zuzanna Janucik Heres something you dont have in England HYDROX COOKIES.
Hydrox is the original Oreo cookie and was invented in 1908 about 5 years 
BEFORE Oreo cookies were invented. Oreo copied them. 
Hydrox were alot cheaper than Oreos and only had one flavor . Hydrox 
stopped making their cookies in 2002 . I liked them. They are supposed to 
be making them again last year but I have never found them in grocery 
stores anywhere. 

http://www.usatoday.com/story/money/business/2014/05/11/hydrox-leaf-brands-oreo-mondelez/8896377/
